chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle without Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Laurana L Poindexter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle without Owner's Consent [Modifiers: Repeater, Conspiracy to Commit], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laurana L Poindexter

records.addlTxt: Revocation Warrant, Order, and Packet on Count 1
Revocation Warrant, Order, and Packet on Count 1
SPD Appointment - Attorney Francis Rivard
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:50 AM Cases called: 20CM274, 21CF537, 22CF189 & 21CM979. Citations 21TR4261, 21TR4260, 21TR4259, 21TR4258, 21TR4257, 21TR7784. Defendant Laurana L Poindexter in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for Laurana L Poindexter. Victim/Witness statute complied with. There is an agreement. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to 21TR4261: OWI 1st, 21CF537: Count 1 Possession of Methamphetamine as a Repeater. 22CF189: Count 1: Drive or Operate Vehicle without Owner's Consent as a Repeater and with the Conspiracy to a Commit enhancer. and Count 2: Felony Bail Jumping. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights.  Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
21TR4261: $811.50, 6 months driver's license revocation and AODA and driver safety plan. 

21CF537: 6 months jail with Huber, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs and 1 bench warrant fee concurrent to 22CF189 with 2 days of jail credit.

22CF189:
Count 1: 2 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions. 

Conditions of Probation 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact C.E. or J.P. 
Restitution to be determined within 60 days plus 10% surcharge
Testify truthfully if called upon to do so.

Count 2: 6 months jail with Huber, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs concurrent to 21CF537 with 65 days of jail credit.

Any other counts and citations, including all of 20CM274 & 21CM979, are ordered dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on April 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(9:33 AM cases 20CM274, 21CM979, 21CF537, 22CF189 called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Laurana L Poindexter appeared in court, in custody. Attorney Scott S. Schlough for Laurana L Poindexter appeared in court.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 21CF537 and Court accepts waiver. 
Attorney Schlough to schedule Arraignment with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
Same as Complaint.

1:31 PM Defendant Laurana L Poindexter appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Scott S. Schlough for Laurana L Poindexter appeared in court, Attorney Peter J. Rindal for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily and Court accepts waiver. 

This case will join Defendant's other cases in intake on 3/16/22 at 9:30am.
Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

State indicates he spoke with Attorney Scott Schlough about this case- requests cases be adjourned. 
Court finds good cause to continue this case.

The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

(Case called at 11:16 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Laurana Poindexter appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Zebulon Patek. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. State requests $7,500 cash bond. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $7,500 cash bond with various conditions. 
Preliminary Hearing: 03/01/2022 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with (co-defendant) J.P.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
